channel.title: Getting npcs to face you + examining them
channel.description:
Hello again :)
So I've been making progress with different parts of the EasyRSC source I'm working on, but there's two things remaining which I'm not having success with.
1) Which file should I be looking at to ensure that when I talk with an npc, they and I turn to face each other? 2) I've been altering the examine text for npcs, mostly just to clear spelling errors; but sometimes I'm coming across npcs in-game and when I right click and examine them, the description doesn't appear in the text line, nothing happens. Which file looks after this?
Many thanks for any help with these.

item.title: Getting npcs to face you + examining them
item.dc:creator: @mft004 mft004
item.description:
@mft004 wrote:

Fair enough, I guess I shouldn’t complain about low ping
Yep I’ll give you a shout if I come across any more issues thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Getting npcs to face you + examining them
item.dc:creator: @gawdz666 gawdz666
item.description:
@gawdz666 wrote:

[quote=“mft004, post:15, topic:552568”]Goodstuff I’ll check out the wait times for the talk events.
As to adding more players, hehe, this was gonna be a singleplayer journey But do you think the ping will increase even if it’s just me playing?[/quote]

Nah man ping will no increase it should be instant because it is all local so there are no hops. Let me know if you ever need anymore help its actually nice helping people who want to learn vs the people who just say gimme codes.

If you got skype and want further help just pm me it.

Read full topic

item.source: Getting npcs to face you + examining them

item.title: Getting npcs to face you + examining them
item.dc:creator: @gawdz666 gawdz666
item.description:
@gawdz666 wrote:

[quote=“mft004, post:13, topic:552568”]Hooray again! The modified descriptions are now recognised. So good when these things work, you’re godlike Gawdz.

One other matter whilst I think on Is there a way to change the speed of the game? I just get the feeling that myself and the npcs are all walking a little bit faster than I remembered - also the dialogue seems to move on to the next sentence faster, e.g. when talking to a banker you almost instantly get to the bank screen; I remember in the old days waiting maybe a second or two before he actually replied ‘certainly sir’. Is that all wrapped up in one settings change or could that all be down to a few settings changes?[/quote]

Check out the wait times on the handlers for npc talk events.

As far as the moving faster well the game engine fires off every 600 ms to send all the packets per client and considering this is a local env it seems faster because your ping is incredible because the client and server are on the same ip.

Don’t worry once you start having ping and more players it will not seem as “fast”.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting npcs to face you + examining them

I just get the feeling that myself and the npcs are all walking a little bit faster than I remembered - also the dialogue seems to move on to the next sentence faster, e.g. when talking to a banker you almost instantly get to the bank screen; I remember in the old days waiting maybe a second or two before he actually replied ‘certainly sir’. Is that all wrapped up in one settings change or could that all be down to a few settings changes?

item.dc:creator: @gawdz666 gawdz666
item.description:
@gawdz666 wrote:

mft004:

Ah well you mentioned .rscd files; the folder back from that data folder had those files (attached pic). Could it be the npcs.rscd file that holds the key?

Yeah right click the NPCs.rscd and extract the contents and edit the xml.gz file it outputs.

item.title: Getting npcs to face you + examining them
item.dc:creator: @mft004 mft004
item.description:
@mft004 wrote:

Brilliant I shall try that.

EDIT: Hi again! Yes the npcs now turn to face me and I to them when I try to talk with them, hooray!

But I saw another problem when I was checking that out. The descriptions I’ve been editing aren’t coming through. So for example, I edited the examine text for a lvl 9 man to say ‘One of Runescape’s many citizens’ but when I examined a man just now, it brought up ‘one of runescapes many citizens’. Any ideas? The file I edited was EasyRSC\Server\conf\server\defs\NPCDef.xml.gz. According to another guide on Moparscape you had to compile when you edited xmls so I did that just in case, but still no change.

Read full topic

item.source: Getting npcs to face you + examining them

item.title: Getting npcs to face you + examining them
item.dc:creator: @gawdz666 gawdz666
item.description:
@gawdz666 wrote:

[quote=“mft004, post:1, topic:552568”]Hello again

So I’ve been making progress with different parts of the EasyRSC source I’m working on, but there’s two things remaining which I’m not having success with.

  1. Which file should I be looking at to ensure that when I talk with an npc, they and I turn to face each other?
  2. I’ve been altering the examine text for npcs, mostly just to clear spelling errors; but sometimes I’m coming across npcs in-game and when I right click and examine them, the description doesn’t appear in the text line, nothing happens. Which file looks after this?

Many thanks for any help with these.[/quote]

It should be when the packet that sends the talktonpc i dunno what that is in the source.

But when the packet is sent add this code i just quickly took it from moparscape.

						if (Formulae.getDirection(owner, affectedNpc) != -1) {
							affectedNpc.setSprite(Formulae.getDirection(owner,
									affectedNpc));
							owner.setSprite(Formulae.getDirection(affectedNpc,
									owner));
						}

add this below to your formulae if it isnt in there.

	public static int getDirection(Mob you, Mob them) {

		if (you.getX() == them.getX() + 1 && you.getY() == them.getY() + 1) // bottom
			// left
			return 3;
		else if (you.getX() == them.getX() + 1 && you.getY() == them.getY() - 1) // top
			// left
			return 1;
		else if (you.getX() == them.getX() - 1 && you.getY() == them.getY() - 1) // right
			// up
			return 7;
		else if (you.getX() == them.getX() - 1 && you.getY() == them.getY() + 1) // right/down
			return 5;
		else if (you.getX() == them.getX() - 1) // face right
			return 6;
		else if (you.getX() == them.getX() + 1) // face left
			return 2;
		else if (you.getY() == them.getY() + 1) // face down
			return 4;
		else if (you.getY() == them.getY() - 1) // face up
			return 0;

		return -1;
	}

and you should be good.

Read full topic
